channel.title: gateway
channel.description: my friend bought a gateway laptop. did he make the biggest mistake ever? whats the pro and cons of the gateway laptop brand?

item.title: gateway
item.dc:creator: russilker
item.description:
Honestly, lets not turn this into another mac/pc debate. Its obvious that PCs are superior in every single way if you are an experienced computer user. /trollbait

Now, gateways are pieces of shit because they use very cheap hardware. And when i sayy cheap I mean half the hardware inside your machine doesn’t have any indication of being made by any brand (no stickers, logos, etc.)

You’ll be replacing hardware in no time and questioning yourself how the power supply couldn’t handle the basic hardware in your PC when it produces more than enough wattage and voltage on the rails.

The only good Mac is a free Mac, and the only good PC is a custom-built one.

EDIT: Oh, and they have tons of bloatware. If for some reason I got a gateway, first thing I’d do is zero-fill the hard drive (not just format it), and reinstall it with a clean version of Windows.

Read full topic

item.title: gateway
item.dc:creator: Jethrosoup
item.description:
BACK ON TOPIC:
I have a Gateway machine. It’s the one I’m using now. And let me tell you, IT BLOWS. Run, run very fast. Whenever I have money, I’m upgrading to something non-Gateway.

Read full topic

item.title: gateway
item.dc:creator: ManlyStump
item.description:
Bolteh:

2 fingers on trackpad + click = right click
ctrl + click = right click

Bolteh:

But that’s the thing. It doesn’t require peripherals. This is just another case of mental retardation.

I don’t see how not being aware of that (simply because I have never had any reason TO learn that) counts as “mental retardation”. Surely it’s just a matter of being ignorant of that one piece of information?

item.title: gateway
item.dc:creator: jerry
item.description:
ManlyStump:

Yes, my mate bought one very recently. Within a couple of weeks he installed Windows 7 over it, and then discovered the issue of having no right button! Obviously he can use a USB mouse but doesn’t it kinda ruin the point of laptops to require peripherals?

Exactly.

Read full topic

item.title: gateway
item.dc:creator: Bolteh
item.description:
2 fingers on trackpad + click = right click
ctrl + click = right click
mouse = right click

To be fair, I actually prefer the 2-finger-click on Macbooks over the right clicking on a 2-button trackpad of other laptops. I don’t have to use both hands or move my fingers, or twitch my thumb to position itself for a left or right click. I just put index- and middlefinger on the trackpad and throw down my thumb in an ergonomic fashion with minimum effort.

Read full topic

item.title: gateway
item.dc:creator: ManlyStump
item.description:
sersoft:

I disagree with the one button joke, but I agree that mac users are gullible enough to rage at it.

What joke?

wheybags:

Wait, do mac laptops actually still only have one mouse button?

Yes, my mate bought one very recently. Within a couple of weeks he installed Windows 7 over it, and then discovered the issue of having no right button! Obviously he can use a USB mouse but doesn’t it kinda ruin the point of laptops to require peripherals?

item.title: gateway
item.dc:creator: ManlyStump
item.description:
jerry:

Yeah but mac laptops:

pros: can install windows, great specifications and battery life
cons: they are not very cheap.

ManlyStump:

Another con: No right click button on the machine.

Dias:

yeah, because we all know macs have their mouses built in, and you can never replace them with non-mac mice. :retard:

Please tell me how to replace the trackpad of a MacBook without making it look like you’ve hacked the thing to pieces, thus rendering the primary benefit of Apple hardware (the aesthetics) redundant? :3

item.title: gateway
item.dc:creator: hypnotek
item.description:
Dias:

yeah, because we all know macs have their mouses built in, and you can never replace them with non-mac mice. :retard:

Well since we are talking about laptops here, you cant exactly go and replace the built in trackpad. You can still attach a standard 2 button mouse for use on a windows installation, but replacing the trackpad would be far too risky.
